part.title: Center Home: The Special Center Administrator GUI Tool
part.para: Special center administrators can perform all necessary administration functions from &center_home;. Note that if you are a special center administrator for more than one special center, each link will first require you to identify which special center you are currently administering prior to granting you access to the specified function.

sect1.title: Approve Orders
sect1.para: This link allows administrators to review and approve array orders. To approve an order, enter any relevant comments in the "Approval Comments" field and click on the "Approve Order" button associated with the specific order. Note that there are several other links on the page that allow the special center administrator to view further information on the owner and creator of the array order and on the associated study.

sect1.title: View Reports
sect1.para:
Special center administrators can use this link to view information on array orders associated with the special center. The following fields are included in the report:
Order Number
An order number is assigned to each array order requested by a user. This unique identifier links the samples to a particular study and set of experimental conditions. In the report, the order number is presented as a link. Clicking on the link is one way to access the page to approve a specific array order.
Is Approved
This column provides the date in which the array order was approved or notes if it has not been approved yet.
Approval Comments
The special center administrator can choose to list comments when approving orders. These comments are displayed here.
Order Status
This field lists the status of the array order.
Study
This field lists the array study associated with the array order.
Study Comments
This field lists the comments associated with the array study.
PI Name
This field lists the name of the PI who owns the data.
Note that the report can be sorted on any of the columns by pressing the button that is the column header.

sect1.title: Edit Special Center Members
sect1.para: This link allows the special center administrator to add and remove members from their special center. When adding users to the special center, their role must be specified (i.e. regular member or administrator member).

To remove a user from the special center, check the checkbox under "Remove User" that is in the same row as the login id for the user you wish to remove. Then click "Modify Members". Several users may be removed simultaneously.

To add a user to the special center as a regular member, check the checkbox under "Add User" that is in the same row as the login id for the user you wish to add. Then click "Modify Members". To add a user to the special center as another special center administrator, check the checkbox under "Add Curator" that is in the same row as the login id for the user you wish to add. Then click "Modify Members". Several users may be added simultaneously.

sect1.title: Edit Special Center Information
sect1.para:
The special center administrator can use this link to modify the specifics of their special center. Special centers have the following characteristics:
Special Center Name
This field is set by the &product; administrator when the special center is created. It can not be modified by the special center administrator, but is displayed for informational purposes.
Special Center Description
This field provides a brief description of the organization. Currently, it is only displayed to the &product; administrator for informational purposes.
Special Center Phone Number
This is the contact number that the &product; administrator should use to contact the special center should the need arise.
Billing Discount
The array center staff inform the &product; administrator about the discount agreement for a special center. Only the &product; administrator can modify this value, but it is displayed here for informational purposes.
Special Center URL
This field displays the URL to to the special center web site. It is used when the special center has a logo displayed on the &product; home page. The logo is linked to this URL.
Special Center Logo
This field allows the special center administrator to assign a logo to the special center. Simply choose the appropriate logo file from drop down box. Only files that have been uploaded via the Upload Logo/Icon File link are available as options.
Special Center Icon
This field allows the special center administrator to assign a icon to the special center. Simply choose the appropriate icon file from drop down box. Only files that have been uploaded via the Upload Logo/Icon File link are available as options.
Although you can set an icon file, it is not yet used by the system. That functionality will be implemented in a future release.
Orders Require Approval Before Array Center Processing
Special center administrators can set whether they want to manually approve array orders or whether approval should be automatic. Check the box for manual approval.

sect1.title: Upload logo/icon file
sect1.para: Depending on how the administrator has configured the special center , the special center may be allowed to place their logo on the home page of the &product; installation. In order to designate a logo, you must first upload it. This link can be used to upload logo files. Once the logo has been uploaded, you will need to associate it with the special center. This is done via that Edit Special Center Information link.
Icons can also be uploaded, but they are not yet used by the system. Eventually, the icons will be to associated users with special centers, but this feature is not yet implemented.

To upload a file, specify where the file is a logo or an icon. Then use the "Choose File" button to identify the file to upload. It is not necessary to specify a filename if you want the filename to remain the same. However, if you would like to rename the file, you may specify the new filename in the "Filename" field. Click "Upload" to upload the file.
